JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Ján Šikuta;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . She was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in ORG .

GPE , GPE – for a provisional residence visa ( machtiging tot voorlopig verblijf ) for the purpose of joining her partner in the GPE , with whom she has a ( minor ) child . By decision of CARDINAL DATE the applicant ’s request was denied by the Minister of ORG . The applicant was deemed a threat to public order given her conviction by the single - judge chamber of ORG ( rechtbank ) of GPE in DATE for theft in association with CARDINAL or more persons , for which offence she had been sentenced to payment of a fine of LAW . The Minister also considered that this refusal did not violate the applicant ’s right to respect for family life as guaranteed by LAW given the fact that it had been the applicant ’s own doing that had led to her conviction and no insurmountable obstacles could be found preventing the applicant and her family from living their family life outside the GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP By decision of CARDINAL DATE the Minister dismissed the applicant ’s objection ( bezwaar ) against the above mentioned decision . The Minister had regard to the fact that ORG ( gerechtshof ) of GPE had upheld the applicant ’s conviction for theft in association with CARDINAL or more persons in DATE and had only reduced the fine to LAW . Furthermore , taking into account the principles set out in the ORG ’s judgments in GPE v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , DATE and PERSON v. the GPE [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , ORG CARDINAL-XII , the Minister considered that the applicant ’s right to respect for family life had not been violated .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant ’s appeal against the decision of CARDINAL DATE was upheld by ORG of The GPE by decision of CARDINAL DATE and the decision of the Minister was subsequently quashed . ORG considered that the Minister had not weighed the ( lack of ) seriousness of the offence committed by the applicant in an appropriate manner .

CARDINAL . NORP The Minister lodged a further appeal with ORG of ORG ( Afdeling Bestuursrechtspraak van de Raad van State ; hereafter “ the ORG ” ) . By decision of CARDINAL DATE the ORG upheld the Minister ’s further appeal , quashed the judgment of ORG on the applicant ’s appeal and rejected that appeal . The ORG held that the authorities had struck a fair balance between all interests involved and that there had been no infringement of the applicant ’s right to respect for family life . Also on DATE , the judgment of the ORG was sent to the lawyer who had represented the applicant pursuant to LAW ( PERSON ) .
